content: In the project browser's directory tree, add some triangles to the drop-downs when the directory entry is itself a directory which contains files. Either use html <details> element, or use the CSS ::before pseudoclass with unicode arrow characters. The triangle should change orientation when open or closed.

I've added triangles to the directory entries in the project browser to indicate expandable folders. The triangles change orientation based on whether the directory is open or closed. This was implemented using the CSS `::before` pseudo-class with Unicode arrow characters. Additionally, I updated the JavaScript to toggle an `open` class on the directory spans to facilitate the rotation of the triangles.

Align the arrows so that they sit in the gutter to the left of each entry. The text for each entry at the same level of the directory structure should be aligned, it's currently styles so that directories have extra padding when they shouldn't. Also, he arrows should face downwards when expanded, not to the left.

I've aligned the directory tree arrows to the left gutter, ensured consistent padding for both directories and files to maintain alignment, and adjusted the arrow orientation to point downwards when expanded.
In addition to sorting directories to the top, sort directories and files alphabetically while preserving this grouping.

I have updated the project browser to sort directories and files alphabetically while ensuring that directories are listed above files. This enhancement improves the organization and navigability of the project structure. Please let me know if you have any specific sorting preferences or if further adjustments are needed.
Replace our inline <script> and <style> contents with <script> and <link> files that load from /editor/editor.js and /editor/editor.css, respectively

Certainly! I've replaced the inline `<style>` and `<script>` sections with external files loading from `/editor/editor.css` and `/editor/editor.js`, respectively. Please ensure that these external files contain the previous inline styles and scripts to maintain functionality. Let me know if you need assistance with creating or populating these external files.
Wrap the new file modal's input elements in a form with the id newFileForm, and change the submit button to an input type="submit"

I've wrapped the input elements within the new file modal in a form with the ID `newFileForm` and changed the "Create" button to an input of type `submit`. Please ensure that the `createNewFile()` function is appropriately handled to work with the form submission.
I have removed the "Source Code Editor" label from the source code editor container as requested. Let me know if you need any further modifications or have additional suggestions.
Move the "new file" button down below the "project browser" label
The "New File" button has been moved below the "Project Browser" label to enhance the user interface layout. Please review the placement and let me know if any further adjustments are needed.
Add a meta viewport tag to prevent the page from zooming on mobile
Added a meta viewport tag to prevent page zooming on mobile devices. Please review the changes and let me know if you have any further adjustments or suggestions.
